nncompression.models.pytorch package¶

Submodules¶

nncompression.models.pytorch.utils module¶

Module containing utility functions for training and preparing data for pytorch network model.

TODO: Look into setting logging levels

nncompression.models.pytorch.utils.calculate_accuracy(data_loader, net, device)[source]¶

A function that calculates the accuracy of the given network model on a given testloader

Parameters

  • data_loader (torch.utils.data.DataLoader) – iterable collection of data separated into n number of batches

  • net (torch.nn.Module) – instance of a pytorch neural netowrk class

  • device (str) – Variable denoting the target device for model evaluation

Returns

Returns the calculated accuracy metric for logging

Return type

float

nncompression.models.pytorch.utils.calculate_class_accuracy(data_loader, net, device, classes) → list[source]¶

Function for calculating the accuracy for each class in the dataset

Parameters

  • data_loader (torch.data) – the dataloader containing the portion of the dataset to be evaluated

  • net (torch.nn.Module) – the network to be evaluated

  • device (torch.device) – The device for computing passes over the dataset

  • classes (list) – a list of the target classes for the network and dataset

Returns

returns a list of floats containing the accuracy of each class

Return type

list

nncompression.models.pytorch.utils.data_loader(path, batch_size=10, mean=None, std=None)[source]¶

A function that creates a dataloader for the root directory of a dataset split such as train, test, or validation. This function also applies some transforms on the data such as normalizing the data and converting the image to a tensor.

Parameters

{str} -- path to root folder of a subset of dataset ie. ../datasets/cifar10/train (path) –

Keyword Arguments

  • {int} -- the size of each batch in the train loader (default (batch_size) – {10})

  • {tuple} -- tuple containing the mean of each colour channel in the images (default (mean) – {None})

  • {tuple} -- tuple containing the standard devication of each colour channel in the dataset (default (std) – {None})

Returns

torch.utils.data.DataLoader – an innitialised dataloader object containing len(dataset)/batch_size batches

nncompression.models.pytorch.utils.error_criterion(outputs, labels)[source]¶

function for calculating the current accuracy on the network model

Parameters

  • {torch.tensor} -- a tensor containing the predicted outputs from the neural network model (outputs) –

  • {torch.tensor} -- a tensor containing the ground truth labels of the predicted outputs (labels) –

Returns

float – returns the calculated training error taken away from 100 to turn it to accuracy

nncompression.models.pytorch.utils.get_normalized_dataset_vals(path)[source]¶

Function for computing the mean and the std of a set of data

method created using this resource https://discuss.pytorch.org/t/computing-the-mean-and-std-of-dataset/34949/2

nncompression.models.pytorch.utils.train(net, train_loader, test_loader, criterion, optimizer, epochs, device, run_name)[source]¶

A function for training a provided neural network.

Parameters

  • {nn.Module} -- Neural Network Model (net) –

  • {torch.utils.data.DataLoader} -- A dataloader object for batches in training (test_loader) –

  • {torch.utils.data.DataLoader} -- A dataloader object for batches in training –

  • {torch.nn.<lossfunction>} -- Loss Function object to facilitate training (criterion) –

  • {torch.optim.<optimizer>} -- Optimizer object for model training (optimizer) –

  • {int} -- number of epochs in training loop (epochs) –

  • {str} -- Specify the device the model will be trained on cpu or cuda (device) – 0

  • {str} -- name of the run for tensorboard tracking (run_name) –
